body.p: Suppose the results indicate that the null hypothesis should not be rejected; thus, it is possible that a type II error has been committed.
Given the type of error made in this situation, what could researchers do to reduce the risk of this error?

input.choice: Choose a 0.01 significance level instead of a 0.05 significance level.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Choosing a smaller significance level will decrease the chance of a type I error because it will make it more difficult to reject the null hypothesis. However, this is a type I error.
Correct. Increasing the sample size is the best way to reduce the likelihood of a type II error.

body.p: A researcher wants to avoid making a type II error. Which of the following actions would be the most effective in reducing the risk of a type II error?

response.feedback: Incorrect. If she chooses an alpha level of 0.05, she has a 5% chance of making a type I error. If she chooses a lower alpha level, it will lower her chance of making a type I error. However, the question focuses on lowering the chances of a type II error, not a type I error.

Incorrect. If she chooses a 0.01 significance level instead of a 0.05 significance level, it would decrease the chance of making a type I error from 5% to 1%. However, question focuses on lowering the chances of a type II error, not a type I error.
Correct. Increasing sample size would be the best way to reduce the chance of making a type II error.
